meanings.definition: Katsinam - plural form of katsina, referring to Hopi spirit beings
meanings.sent1: During the ceremony, the katsinam danced around the fire, bringing blessings.
meanings.sent2: The katsinam are believed to bring rain and good harvests to the Hopi people.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous katsinam decided to play a prank on the village elders during the festival.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the katsinam seemed to glow with an otherworldly light.
meanings.sent5: The intricate details on the katsinam dolls made them look almost alive.

meanings.definition: Katsinam - used as a noun to describe ceremonial dolls representing katsina spirits in Hopi culture
meanings.sent1: The children carefully crafted their own katsinam for the upcoming ceremony.
meanings.sent2: Visitors to the Hopi reservation often purchase katsinam dolls as souvenirs.
meanings.sent3: One katsinam doll accidentally fell into the ceremonial cake, causing laughter among the attendees.
meanings.sent4: The katsinam dolls stood in a row, each one unique and full of character.
meanings.sent5: The old katsinam doll had been passed down for generations, carrying stories of the past.
